ratings.comment: Gave clear and easy-to-understand lectures. Addressed students' questions clearly. Very approachable during office hours.

Math 421 is not easy, but his style is clear and straight forward. The weekly HW is harder than exam, and the exam is comparably fine for me. He will reply email pretty fast, very good professor, lectures are pretty clear. He is the only Prof I recommend even when it turns to online due to COVID, pretty good prof.

Professor Schrecker is the best professor Ive had at Madison. He talks fast but is always willing to stop and answer questions. He responds to emails faster than anyone and gives great feedback. Homework and tests are very straightforward and fair.

He speaks so fast that you can never follow him. Many of us are still coping notes from the blackboard, but he already begins a new topic. Also, he does not explain things that clear. I found many contradictions of his theorem and examples, and I had to spend extra time asking him or classmates.
There can't be a better professor for Mathematics or Analysis.

This is a tough class, so he has to go fast in class to cover all the material, but he fully explains the concept behind each proof, and will take pauses for questions. He's patient/understanding & v helpful in office hrs. He also typed up notes for the ENTIRE semester to help us study, and has a soothing British accent. Def my fave math prof at UW

Prof. Schrecker is probably the most competent math professor I have had at UW. His lectures are fast-paced but he clearly explains concepts and will stop to answer questions. He is also extremely accessible in office hours and always happy to explain concepts you may not have understood in lecture. Very tough class but great teacher.

He made everything super clear and did explain the ideas behind the proofs. He is also extremely nice to students. Although he has a fast speed in order to cover all the materials, you cannot expect a better math teacher. Feel very lucky to take analysis course with him.

Prof. Schrecker writes really really fast. In class I just copied what he writes and have no time to think about what the note means, so after class I actually learned nothing. I think he is trying to cover all the materials instead of letting students understand. Homework is hard too. I spent hours doing it. But he is patient for questions.

Professor Schrecker's lecture is boring. He writes note soooo fast that you can not catch up with him. After lecture, you probably learn nothing but your hand is sour. Homework due every week but it only has 5-6 questions. It is not that hard but you need to spend hours on it.
